intro: Erucaria tetrastachya, commonly known as the four-branched erucaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
